ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class Plane

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.Plane

public class Plane
extends java.lang.Object

The class Plane is used as a user interaction to move objects. It is only possible to move the objects in two dimensions. The plane is used to appropriately manipulate the position of the objects. They are always updated in respect of the camera, i.e. that the camera specifies how the 2D plane lies in the 3D space.
A plane is defined by a point in the 3D space that lies on the plane and by the normal that is associated with the plane.

Constructor Detail

Plane

public Plane(Camera camera)
Instantiates a new plane.

Parameters:
camera - the camera that specifies how the plane lies in the 3D space

Plane

public Plane(Camera camera,
             boolean mode2d)
Instantiates a new plane.

Parameters:
camera - the camera that specifies how the plane lies in the 3D space
mode2d - specifies whether the plane can be placed arbitrarily in the 3D space or only on the xy-axis. This is used for the physics simulation, where all the objects need to be aligned in one plane.
Method Detail

intersect

public RayShapeIntersection intersect(Ray ray)
Intersects the plane with a ray. This is used to determine how much an object needs to be translated. There will always be two different rays shot through the 3D-scene and the intersections with the plane completely specify the translation.

Parameters:
ray - the ray that is to be shot through the scene.
Returns:
a RayShapeIntersecion, a data structure that holds information about where a hit between a ray and an object occurred.

update

public void update(javax.vecmath.Vector3f target,
                   javax.vecmath.Vector3f current)
Updates the node that is currently set for this plane in respect to the two different hit points that were found by intersecting the rays with this plane.

Parameters:
cur - the target position
prev - the current position

setNode

public void setNode(Node node)
Sets the node that this plane will manipulate.

Parameters:
node - the new node
